meanings.definition: Having Mars as a central point.
meanings.sent1: The areocentric map displayed Mars at the center.
meanings.sent2: The scientist's areocentric theory focused on Mars as the main planet of interest.
meanings.sent3: In the areocentric painting, Mars was depicted as the heart of the solar system.
meanings.sent4: Her areocentric beliefs made her see everything revolving around Mars like a cosmic dance.
meanings.sent5: The areocentric model placed Mars in the spotlight, shining brightly among the other planets.

meanings.definition: Relating to a perspective or viewpoint centered on Mars.
meanings.sent1: The areocentric telescope allowed astronomers to observe Mars with great detail.
meanings.sent2: The areocentric approach to space exploration prioritized missions to Mars.
meanings.sent3: His areocentric obsession with Mars led him to collect Martian memorabilia.
meanings.sent4: The areocentric view from the spaceship made Mars appear larger than life.
meanings.sent5: Through an areocentric lens, Mars seemed to hold the secrets of the universe within its red surface.
